sentence.text: Mice with a homozygous null mutation in cellular sodium ion homeostasis (Nhe1) exhibited ataxia, recurrent seizures, and selective neuronal cell death.

In humans, three unrelated patients have been reported: a patient with a homozygous missense mutation in cellular sodium ion homeostasis, c.913GAAAAA (p.Gly305Arg), which caused Lichtenstein-Knorr syndrome characterized by cerebellar ataxia and sensorineural hearing loss, a patient with compound heterozygous mutations, c.1351AAAAAC (p.Ile451Leu) and c.1585CAAAAT (p.His529Tyr), which caused a neuromuscular disorder, and a patient with de novo mutation, c.796AAAAAC (p.Asn266His) which associated multiple anomalies.
The main clinical feature was similar to Lichtenstein-Knorr syndrome but deafness may not be an essential phenotypic feature of cellular sodium ion homeostasis mutation.
